name: Turbo Focus
desc: Extends the range of the Turbo Cannon by %s. Conquest's Turbo Cannon matches that of the ship's longest-ranged non-missile weapon, capped at 1000

name: Coordinated Maneuvers
desc: Fighters are catapult-launched when deployed. When returning or regrouping, their maximum speed increases by %s. Fighter maneuverability increases by %s per wing.

name: Flexible Hangar
desc: When the hangar is full, provides additional refit speed and deploys reserve fighters.

name: Torpedo Scheme
desc: Reduces the ammo capacity of missile weapons by %s, and increases missile top speed and acceleration by half of the energy weapon range bonus. Reduces the ordnance point cost of missile weapons by %s.

name: Time Anchor
desc: Peak performance time is unaffected by the flow of time. Reduces the rate of in-combat CR decay after peak performance time runs out by %s.

name: Pocket Capital
desc: All medium non-missile weapons deal %s more damage. Increases ammo/charge regeneration rate for non-missile weapons by %s.

name: Fearless Machine
desc: Significantly reduces the time required to repair weapons and engines (in combat). Increases the ship's top speed when the nearest enemy is more than 800su away.

name: Drift System
desc: When near an arc cloud, increases the ship's top speed by %s, maneuverability by %s, boost energy weapon rate of fire by %s and reduce energy weapon flux cost by %s.

name: Freischütz
desc: Weapons are used to select the type of magic bullet. All weapons share the same cooldown and ammo capacity. Ammo can only be regenerated while the ship is phased. Every 7th bullet targets a random enemy.

name: Flanker Strategy
desc: Order the flanker to maintain a certain distance from the target.

name: Spirit
desc: "Hear that? They're singing."

name: Spare Part Production
desc:
Decreases combat readiness consumed by the fleet for entering combat by %s, up to a maximum of %s.
Number of available "Combat Auto-Maintenance Systems" in the fleet is %s.

name: Leviathan Hunter
desc:
Extends weapon range by %s when the tactical system is fully activated.
+%s damage to capital ships and cruisers
During %s, the tactical system cannot be activated. The ship instead enters Mobility Mode, increasing the ship's top speed by %s and maneuverability by %s.

name: Light Torpedo Scheme
desc:
Reduces the ordnance point cost of guided missile weapons by %s. Missile weapons that regenerate ammo no longer do so, but their ammo is increased by an equivalent of %s seconds of reserves.

Incompatible with Expanded Missile Racks.

name: Arbalétrier
desc: Greatly reduces the time required to repair weapons and engines (in combat).

name: Matrix Targeting
desc:
When friendly vessels are within approximately %s of this ship, extend their range by %s. Extends the range of this ship by %s.
Has a well-balanced range.

name: Enhanced Sensors
desc: Increases the ship's in-combat vision range.

name: Abyssal Stalker
desc:
Increases missile top speed and acceleration by an amount equal to the energy weapon range bonus, and extends the range of missile weapons by %s of the energy weapon range bonus.

Increases the ordnance point cost of guided missile weapons by %s.

name: Mirage
desc:
For every %s damage taken before damage reduction, become invincible for %s seconds and gain %s additional barrier.

For every %s hull damage taken, gain %s of the above effect.

Barrier capacity is set to %s.

name: Daylight Core
desc: Greatly increases damage to fighters and missiles. Greatly reduces the time required to repair weapons and engines (in combat) as well as overload duration. Embedded with an intelligence of unknown origin.

name: Halo System
desc: A versatile hull framework incorporating a wide range of advanced technologies. Reduces the effectiveness of non-native flux modifications by %s.

name: E.G.O
desc: [REDACTED]

name: Entanglement System
desc: Ship modules enter combat as independent ships and maintain some connection to the main body. Modules do not consume deployment points, and continue to fight even after the main body is destroyed or retreats.

name: Contrail
desc: Mark this ship as requiring a contrail. No other use.

name: Drone Ground Support
desc: The ship's drone units will participate in ground combat. Increases the effectiveness of planetary raids by %s per wing, up to the total number of marines in the fleet.

name: Shield Link Framework
desc: A linked shield framework designed for smaller ships. When friendly vessels that also carry this framework are within approximately %s of this ship, mutually replenish shields, at a rate equal to %s of the lower recovery speed among them.

name: 3rd Guards Fleet
desc: Decreases the effect operating in a solar corona as on combat readiness by 100%. Increases maximum burn in hyperspace by %s.

name: Stalker
desc:
Specially configured subsystems that are installed drastically reduce weapon ranges past %s, increase barrier recovery rate by %s,  and allows zero-flux engine boost to take effect regardless of flux level. The flux dissipation rate is increased by a factor of %s.
Side effects reduce barrier capacity by %s, reduce peak performance time by %s, and prevents the use of active venting.
Incompatible with %s.

name: Elite Foundry
desc:
An elite ship built with bleeding-edge technology. Equipped with an improved barrier system, increasing barrier capacity by %s and barrier regeneration speed by %s.

This ship's barrier can be controlled like shields and will automatically activate while overloaded or actively venting flux. Its damage reduction is calculated solely based on shield damage reduction. If no shield is present, the barrier remains constantly active.

name: 1st Guards Fleet
desc: Increases the ship's top speed in combat by %s and maneuverability by %s.

name: Void Shield
desc: There is nothing to see. It is just an ellipse.

name: Hyper Shunted Permeable Armor
tech/manufacturer: Halo Dynamics Department of Science and Technology
desc:
An advanced armor system with significant drawbacks. Increases maximum damage reduction by armor by %s and reduces damage from beam weapons by %s.
Allows reactors to slowly vent through the armor, naturally dissipating %s hard flux.
The complex structure occupies space meant for weapon systems, reducing weapon damage by %s. Additionally, the intricate materials are difficult to maintain, reducing post-battle repair rates by %s.

name: Tactical Center
desc:
Reduces the weapon range reduction due to superior enemy Electronic Warfare by %s.
Increases Electronic Warfare strength by %s.
Increases sensor range by %s.

name: Power Projection
desc:
Increases fighter engagement range by %s.
Fighters launched from this ship inherit all of the ship's combat skills.

name: Nanofield
desc: Friendly vessels within %s of this ship restore %s of lost armor and hull per second. This ship's repair speed is %s.

name: Juggernaut Targeting Core
desc: Extends weapon range by %s. The range of point defense-weapons is only extended by %s.

name: Juggernaut Core
desc: Unable to use zero-flux engine boost.

name: Armored Shield
desc: Barrier has additional %s armor value.

name: Mobility Focus
desc: The propulsion system's heavy energy and space demands increase the damage taken by the barrier by %s.

name: Unstoppable
desc: Increases barrier capacity by %s, decreases barrier recovery rate by %s,

name: Weapons Industry Adaptation Kit
desc:
Convert some weapons into modified versions provided by the Weapons Industry.
#Modified weapons cannot be safely removed. Please uninstall this hullmod before attempting removal.
##Weapons Industry shall not be held liable for any loss incurred as a result of improper procedures.

name: Weapons Industry Upgrade Kit
desc: Activates the weapon's %s effect.

name: Hardened Barrier
desc:
Increases barrier strength by %s.
Damage to the barrier above %s is reduced by %s.

name: Enhanced Barrier
desc: Increases barrier capacity by %s. Increases barrier recovery rate by %s.

name: Meltdown Protocol
desc:
Beam weapons deal %s more damage based on the ratio of weapon slots occupied by Halo Dynamics beam weapons.
Enhances the additional effects of Halo Dynamics beam weapons by %s.

Current weapon slot ratio: %s.

name: Assault Protocol
desc: Increases the rate of fire of ballistic and energy weapons as flux levels rise, up to a maximum of %s at %s flux.
sModDesc: Also provides a equivalent flux cost reduction of up to %s to the weapons.

name: Suppression Protocol
desc:
When dealing damage to a target more than %s su from this ship, the target gains the [Coordinated Suppression] effect for a certain duration.
Each stack of [Coordinated Suppression] increases all damage taken by the target to its %s based on the hull size of the source. The duration can be refreshed. A maximum of %s stacks from different sources can take effect, with only the highest stack applied.
sModDesc: In addition, an extra stack of [Coordinated Suppression] with the effect of %s can be applied to the target that does not count toward the maximum limit.

name: Automated Combat Repair System
desc:
Automatically repairs armor lost during combat, up to a maximum of approximately %s points. The total repaired will not be less than %s and will not exceed %s.
Repairs begin immediately after armor is damaged, restoring armor cells one by one from left to right, bottom to top, at a rate of %s per second.
Increases the speed at which weapons and engines are repaired (in combat) by %s.

name: Hidden Hardpoint
desc: The hardpoint is hidden inside the ship's hull.

name: Teleport Effect
desc: Rendering effects.

name: Vent Effect
desc: Rendering effects.

name: Fighter Return
desc: Return when out of ammunition.

name: Longevity
desc: "Spare me your tired little gimmicks."

name: Dreadnought Module
desc: The Ukiyo-class is an advanced modular dreadnought that can be refitted in any standard dock. While docked, it can switch between three different tactical modes by installing one of three special hullmods. Any switch will unload all subsystem modifications, fighters, and incompatible weapons.

name: Self-Destruct Canceller
desc: Virtually no self-detonation.

name: Ukiyo-Assault
desc: Convert the Ukiyo-class to Assault Mode. This configuration focuses on electronic warfare and fleet firepower enhancement, boosting the performance of friendly vessels in conventional firefights.

name: Ukiyo-Carrier
desc: Convert the Ukiyo-class to Carrier Mode. This configuration focuses on extending fleet awareness and launching full-deck assaults, but requires support from friendly carriers built with similar operational philosophy.

name: Ukiyo-Heavy
desc: Convert the Ukiyo-class to Heavy Mode. This configuration focuses on sustained combat and survivability.

name: Adventure Mode Projection
desc: Hunting time?
